agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based organization that provides a free hot meal to those in need in Decatur County.
service_description: Provides a free hot meal to those in need living in Decatur County. Delivery may be available to people who are homebound or who have no transportation based on assessment.
site_details: Walk in
site_schedule: Meals: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 3pm-5pm -- Office: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-5pm
Meals: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 3pm-5pm -- Office: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-5pm
Meals: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 3pm-5pm -- Office: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: For Walk In Meal: Living in Decatur County -- For Meal Delivery: Living in the city of Greensburg in Decatur County -- Homebound -- Have a transportation need (based on assessment) -- To Volunteer: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that matches at-risk youth with adult mentors.
service_description: Matches children in need with professionally supported adult mentors who have shared interests. Mentors volunteer one to two times per month for at least one year. Programs for mentoring are provided weekends, evenings, out-of-school times, and now in-school times also.
site_details: To Volunteer or Request a Mentor: Call, walk in, or visit website to complete application.
site_eligibility: Mentors: Age 16 or older with valid drivers license -- Youth Participants: Ages 6-18 at time of enrollment

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; by appointment only-- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: Provides electric service to customers within the service area.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in portions of Bartholomew, Decatur, Franklin, Jennings, Ripley, and Rush counties.
site_details: Call for assistance; Bills can be paid online, in person, by mail, by phone; a drop box is available at this location.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Bartholomew, Decatur, Franklin, Jennings, Ripley, and Rush counties

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Decatur County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, walk in or call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Decatur County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Greensburg in Decatur County.
service_description: Provides water and sanitary sewer utility services for the city of Greensburg in Decatur County.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call for assistance. Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Greensburg in Decatur County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Greensburg in Decatur County.
service_description: Responsible for the collection of trash, garbage, and yard waste for residents within the city limits of Greensburg. Trash is picked up weekly on a fixed route. Households are limited to 5 (not to exceed 30 gallon) bags a week. Oil drums, barrels, or like containers are not accepted. Brush pick up is ONLY for branches or limbs that have fallen during a storm.
site_details: Sign up when requesting utility services.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Greensburg in Decatur County

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Decatur County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Decatur County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers empty bags to be filled with sand to prevent flood damage.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open; serves Decatur County

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from Decatur County Memorial Hospital.
site_details: Patients must submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance. Call the Credit Department to request a Financial Assistance Application. -- If uninsured must meet with the Patient Navigator
site_eligibility: Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from Decatur County Memorial Hospital (or guarantor of someone who received such services)

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a range of primary medical services (including general, school/sports/employment exams; disease management; immunizations; infant well checks; simple wound repair; and specialty physician referrals) to patients of all ages.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a range of primary medical services (including general, school/sports/employment exams; disease management; immunizations; infant well checks; simple wound repair; and specialty physician referrals) to patients of all ages.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based nonproft that provides counseling and a yearly free oil change event open to the public.
service_description: Offers free faith-based counseling for both adults and teens.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website to fill out an intake form.
site_schedule: Scheduling: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 9am-4pm -- Counseling: Vary
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: GREENSBURG - DECATUR COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY - GREENSBURG BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, and Thurs 9am-8pm; Wed 9am-6pm; Fri 9am-5pm; Sat 9am-1pm
Mon, Tues, and Thurs 9am-8pm; Wed 9am-6pm; Fri 9am-5pm; Sat 9am-1pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Decatur County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: GREENSBURG - DECATUR COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY - WESTPORT BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Decatur County

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A nonprofit water utility provider.
service_description: Provides water utility services.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance or visit website for information. Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Decatur and Jennings counties

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call or send an email to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides families and individuals the skills necessary to become self sufficient through intervention and education.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Decatur County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list is currently closed. --  No applications are available at this time. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_schedule: Dates and times are month to month; call to confirm schedule
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. -- Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Decatur County.
service_description: Maintains the Decatur County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Visitation must be scheduled at www.inmates.com.
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides home delivered meals for individuals in need.
service_description: Provides meals to persons who are elderly or who have other qualifying situations such as being post-surgery, losing a spouse, or are homebound. Provides a hot meal to those in the city limits and a frozen meal outside the city limits. An extra meal is delivered the day before a holiday.
site_details: Call to complete an assessment. Must schedule meal delivery one week in advance.
site_eligibility: Homebound or other qualifying situations, call for information.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: New Directions of Decatur County strives to increase social consciousness about domestic violence and to assist individual victims break free from the cycle of physical and emotional abuse.
service_description: Offers emergency shelter for up to 4 days to individuals with or without dependent children when they are in imminent physical danger from domestic violence.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call crisis line for intake.
site_eligibility: Decatur County residents preferred; will accept individuals from surrounding counties if room is available -- Individuals in imminent physical danger from domestic violence

agency_name: COMMUNITY HEALTHCARE CLINIC OF DECATUR COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides healthcare to people with a financial need.
site_name: COMMUNITY HEALTHCARE CLINIC OF DECATUR COUNTY
service_description: Provides medical services to people with a financial need. Services include treatment of minor illnesses and education for chronic and acute illnesses.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. -- Visit the website for income chart.
site_eligibility: Fall within income guidelines -- Have no insurance benefits -OR- inadequate insurance such as high co-pays and fees

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization serving Decatur County individuals with needs not met by other community agencies.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food, hygiene supplies, and cleaning products to those in need. Limited service area
site_details: Call for information or to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Decatur County

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that provides free clothing to persons in need.
service_description: Provides clothing to families who have been affected by a disaster including house fire or natural disaster.
site_details: Call and leave a message to request assistance.
site_eligibility: Living in Decatur County -- Families affected by a disaster

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a substance use support group.
service_description: Offers a Christian-based, 12-Step program to persons seeking peer support. Support topics include chemical dependency, and general life issues. After group lesson, smaller, gender-specific groups are formed for further discussion. Child care is provided during the meetings and children have structured instruction. Meets court-ordered requirements. A meal is provided before the meeting.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including  an emergency food pantry, weekly food giveaway, support group, and shelter during times of disaster.
service_description: Provides pastoral counseling and grief support to those who are experiencing grief.
taxonomy_name: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel5: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Only when sirens are sounded during severe weather situations
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides quarterly clothing giveaways.
service_description: Provides free, new and used clothing, under garments, socks, and shoes for children in K-6th grade. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment to shop.
site_eligibility: Children in K-6th grade -- Children must be present

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to seniors in need. Bagged breakfast may also be provided depending on availability. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Living in Decatur County -- Age 55 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a safe house for children in need.
service_description: Provides a safe home for children while parents work through difficult situations to prevent the need for the State to step-in and remove the children. Provides support to parents in finding housing and/or jobs, if applicable. Helps restore/reunite families that have hit a difficult time. Length of stay varies depending on family situation.
site_details: Call the hotline to complete an assessment.
site_eligibility: Children, age 4-8 years-old

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours. Psychiatric rehabilitation may be offered to eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.
site_schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: In need of mental health or addiction services (based on assessment)

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Decatur County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Decatur County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Decatur County

agency_desc: A government agency that receives payment of property taxes.
service_description: Collects taxes and in the case of delinquent taxes may order the sale of real property to pay delinquent taxes. Receives distributions of local income and other taxes that are collected by the state such as real estate tax, personal property tax, mobile home tax, state assessed tax, and the following miscellaneous taxes: auto excise tax, inheritance tax, and innkeeper's tax.
site_eligibility: Open; serves properties in Decatur County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Decatur County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Decatur County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8am
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in the city of Greensburg in Decatur County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept Senior and WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks and participate in the SNAP dollar matching program for qualifying food items.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Decatur County -- Veterans and surviving spouses and children of veterans

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Decatur County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Decatur County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Decatur County)

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Greensburg and Washington Township of Decatur County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in Washington Township and the city of Greensburg in Decatur County. Nonemergency services include fire prevention education and public awareness. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Greensburg in Decatur County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Greensburg in Decatur County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Decatur County dispatch after hours.
site_schedule: Dispatch: Daily 24 hours -- Office: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-4pm; Wed 8am-11am
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Greensburg in Decatur County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.

service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Decatur County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact Decatur County Superior Court.

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in the city of Greensburg in Decatur County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept Senior and WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks and participate in the SNAP dollar matching program for qualifying food items.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering transitional housing for men seeking recovery from substance use.
service_description: Offers transitional housing for men recovering from alcohol or drug addiction for a fee. Residents must attend 12-step recovery meetings and adhere to house rules. Support services include life-skills classes and referrals to social services.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website, send email, or call for an application.
site_eligibility: Men, 18 or older -- With income (such as employment or SSI/SSD) -- Recovering from substance abuse -- Clean Drug Test
